io.github.flowersinthesand.portal

Interface Socket


  • public interface Socket
    Socket is a connectivity between the two portal endpoints.

    Sockets may be accessed by multiple threads.

    Author:
    Donghwan Kim

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Socket.Reply<T>
      Interface to deal with reply.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Socket close()
      Closes the session.
      String id()
      The id.
      <T> Socket off(String event, Action<T> action)
      Removes a given added event handler for a given event.
      <T> Socket on(String event, Action<T> action)
      Adds a given event handler for a given event.
      Socket send(String event)
      Sends a given event without data.
      Socket send(String event, Object data)
      Sends a given event with data.
      <T> Socket send(String event, Object data, Action<T> reply)
      Sends a given event with data registering callback.
      Set<String> tags()
      The tag set.
      String uri()
      The URI used to connect.

    • Method Detail

      • id

        String id()
        The id.

      • uri

        String uri()
        The URI used to connect.

      • tags

        Set<String> tags()
        The tag set.

      • on

        <T> Socket on(String event,
            Action<T> action)
        Adds a given event handler for a given event.

        The allowed types for T are Java types corresponding to JSON types.

        JSON Java
        Number Integer or Double
        String String
        Boolean Boolean
        Array List, List<T> in generic
        Object Map, Map<String, T> in generic
        null null, Void for convenience
        If the counterpart sends an event with callback, T should be Socket.Reply.

      • off

        <T> Socket off(String event,
             Action<T> action)
        Removes a given added event handler for a given event.

      • send

        Socket send(String event)
        Sends a given event without data.

      • send

        Socket send(String event,
          Object data)
        Sends a given event with data.

      • send

        <T> Socket send(String event,
              Object data,
              Action<T> reply)
        Sends a given event with data registering callback.

        For the allowed types for T, see on(String, Action).

      • close

        Socket close()
        Closes the session.
